Weighted Interquartile Range (IQR)

Source: R/w_iqr.R
w_iqr.Rd

Calculate weighted interquartile range (Q3 - Q1) for numeric variables, with support for grouped data and multiple variables simultaneously.

Usage

w_iqr(data, ..., weights = NULL, na.rm = TRUE)

Arguments

data

A data frame, or a numeric vector when used in summarise() context

...

Variable names (unquoted) or tidyselect expressions

weights

Name of the weights variable (unquoted), or a numeric vector of weights

na.rm

Logical; if TRUE, missing values are removed (default: TRUE)

Value

A w_iqr object (list) containing results and metadata, or numeric values in summarise context

Examples

# Load required packages and data
library(dplyr)
data(survey_data)

# Basic weighted interquartile range
survey_data %>% w_iqr(age, weights = sampling_weight)
#> 
#> Weighted IQR Statistics
#> ----------------------- 
#> # A tibble: 1 × 3
#>   Variable weighted_iqr effective_n
#>   <chr>           <dbl>       <dbl>
#> 1 age                25       2469.
#> 

# Multiple variables
survey_data %>% w_iqr(age, income, life_satisfaction, weights = sampling_weight)
#> 
#> Weighted IQR Statistics
#> ----------------------- 
#> # A tibble: 3 × 3
#>   Variable          weighted_iqr effective_n
#>   <chr>                    <dbl>       <dbl>
#> 1 age                         25       2469.
#> 2 income                    1900       2159.
#> 3 life_satisfaction            2       2391.
#> 

# Grouped data
survey_data %>% group_by(region) %>% w_iqr(age, weights = sampling_weight)
#> 
#> Weighted IQR Statistics
#> ----------------------- 
#> 
#> Group: region = East
#> # A tibble: 1 × 2
#>   weighted_iqr effective_n
#>          <dbl>       <dbl>
#> 1           24         477
#> 
#> Group: region = West
#> # A tibble: 1 × 2
#>   weighted_iqr effective_n
#>          <dbl>       <dbl>
#> 1           24       1993.
#> 

# In summarise context
survey_data %>% summarise(iqr_age = w_iqr(age, weights = sampling_weight))
#> # A tibble: 1 × 1
#>   iqr_age
#>     <dbl>
#> 1      25

# Unweighted (for comparison)
survey_data %>% w_iqr(age)
#> 
#> IQR Statistics
#> -------------- 
#> # A tibble: 1 × 3
#>   Variable   iqr     n
#>   <chr>    <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1 age         24  2500
#>
